meanings.sent1: The spinning teacup ride made me feel giddy.
meanings.sent2: She felt giddy after spinning around in circles.
meanings.sent3: The giddy feeling from the merry-go-round made her laugh.
meanings.sent4: His giddy head was like a balloon floating in the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The giddy sensation was as if the room was dancing around her.

meanings.definition: Excited to the point of being silly or giddy.
meanings.sent1: The children were giddy with excitement on the eve of Christmas.
meanings.sent2: Her giddy laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent3: Their giddy behavior at the party was infectious.
meanings.sent4: The giddy atmosphere was like a bubble of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The giddy anticipation of the surprise made her heart race.

meanings.sent1: The roller coaster ride can giddy up even the bravest souls.
meanings.sent2: His jokes never fail to giddy up the crowd.
meanings.sent3: She tried to giddy him up with a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: The thrilling movie plot giddied up the audience.
meanings.sent5: The surprise party plan giddied up her friends for the celebration.
